title: Apple's Vision Pro VR Headset to Revive 3D Movies in Home
originSummary: Apple's upcoming virtual reality headset, Vision Pro, will support 3D movies, providing users with an immersive movie-watching experience.
Apple has already listed 19 movies with 3D support in the Apple TV app for Vision Pro, including popular titles like Jurassic World Dominion and Kung Fu Panda 3.
However, it remains unclear whether existing rentals and purchases will include 3D support or if a separate purchase will be required.
Comfort is a concern with the Vision Pro headset, but Apple is actively working on developing a lighter and more comfortable successor.
XR headsets like the Vision Pro have the potential to bring back 3D movies to the home, but addressing comfort challenges is crucial for a seamless and enjoyable experience.

title: Telegram Unveils App for Apple Vision Pro's Mixed Reality Headset
originSummary: Telegram is launching a visionOS app for Apple's Vision Pro mixed reality headset, enabling users to access Telegram on their devices starting next year.
The app will have a translucent interface for chat access, voice messaging capability, and a virtual keyboard for typing.
This move aligns with the design principles of visionOS and will be available on the Vision Pro when it becomes available in 2024.

title: Apple TV app now supports 3D movies, hinting at Vision Pro headset
originSummary: Apple's TV app now supports 3D movies, hinting at the release of Apple's Vision Pro headset in the future.
The inclusion of popular titles implies that Apple might have developed a new file format specific to the headset.
Although there are no original 3D movies or series at the moment, Apple is focused on delivering a smooth and enjoyable viewing experience with their stereoscopic 3D technology.

title: Meta Quest 3 Faces Controller Tracking Issues; Competition from Apple's Vision Pro
originSummary: Meta, a virtual reality company, is investigating reports of controller tracking issues on its latest headset, the Quest 3, with users experiencing a decrease in motion tracking quality, particularly in fast-paced games.
Meta's support team is actively investigating the matter, but it is unclear when the issues will be resolved.
Market demand for the Quest 3 appears to be lower than expected, leading Meta to adjust shipment forecasts for the fourth quarter of 2023.
Apple's upcoming Vision Pro headset is expected to be technologically superior but at a significantly higher price.
Meta is aiming to maintain its position in the VR market by addressing reported issues and providing enhanced features.

title: Double Tap: A Reliable and Impressive Apple Watch Gesture Control Feature
originSummary: The "Double Tap" feature on the Apple Watch is a gesture control system that allows users to perform actions by tapping their fingers together.
The author initially had doubts about the feature but found it to be reliable and impressive.
The functionality is limited and not necessary to use all the time, but the author speculates on its future potential and integration with the Vision Pro headset.

title: Xreal Air AR Glasses for iPhone 15: Affordable Augmented Reality Experience
originSummary: The iPhone 15 now supports USB-C and native video out, enabling compatibility with new accessories like augmented reality (AR) glasses.
The Xreal Air AR glasses are priced between $300 and $500 and feature a 120Hz, 0.68-inch MicrOLED display that reflects onto the lenses, providing an immersive viewing experience.

These glasses are compatible with the iPhone 15, allowing for gaming and productivity applications, and can be customized with prescription lenses and accessories like the Xreal Beam for a more immersive virtual display. They provide a cost-effective alternative for AR compared to Apple's Vision Pro.

title: iPhone 16 Series to Introduce 17 Exciting New Features in 2024
originSummary: The iPhone 16 series, slated for a 2024 release, is rumored to bring 17 new features including larger displays, a vertical camera layout, and a physical "Capture Button."
Other anticipated enhancements include upgraded camera lenses, Wi-Fi 7 support, a new A18 Pro chip, 5G Advanced connectivity, solid-state buttons, and improved battery technology.
There may also be an "Ultra" model along with a fresh thermal design. The official announcement for these devices is expected to be made in September 2024.

title: Apple's Magic Mouse Fixed: USB-C Charging Port and Ergonomic Design Added
originSummary: Engineer Ivan Kuleshov has proposed a concept for Apple's Magic Mouse to address the issue of inability to charge while in use.
The concept replaces the Lightning charging port with a USB-C port in the front right corner, allowing for functionality while charging.
Kuleshov also enhanced the mouse with an ergonomic frame and RGB lighting, aiming to improve user experience.
Users have criticized the current design of the Magic Mouse for its lack of ergonomics and inconvenient charging port placement.

title: Meta Oculus Quest 3: Specs, Release Date, and Where to Buy
originSummary: The Meta Oculus Quest 3 is a new mixed-reality headset priced at $499, available from major retail sites like Best Buy and Amazon.
It comes in two variants, 128GB and 512GB, both bundled with the game Asgard's Wrath 2.
The Quest 3 offers several upgrades over the previous Quest 2, including a faster processor, more RAM, higher refresh rate, better display, and a smaller, lighter design.
